alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 1:43PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...A Strong Storm Moves Through the Panhandle This Weekend... A gale force low with a significant source of subtropical moisture will enter the Gulf of Alaska Saturday. Heaviest rainfall is expected Saturday afternoon and into the evening. By Sunday, the plume of moisture will shift away from Juneau allowing for diminishing precipitation. For those along the Mendenhall River, the rainy and windy conditions could increase the risk of trees falling into and around the river from the already unstable river banks. Estimates show widespread 2 to 3 inches of rain is expected to fall from Saturday morning to early Sunday morning. From the this heavy precipitation, expect to see rapid rises in small rivers and creeks but at this time they will remain within their banks. This front will also bring windy conditions to Southeast communities. Sustained winds between 15 to 25 mph with periods of high gusts to 30 to 40 mph are likely. Expected the strongest winds Saturday afternoon.
